core_concepts.overview: Symphony is a TypeScript SDK for building AI-powered applications with orchestrated tools, agents, teams, and pipelines. It provides a unified interface for complex AI workflows with advanced features like tool chaining, parallel execution, custom agent directives, system prompt override, and intelligent caching.

architecture.layer: Tools, Agents, Teams, Pipelines, Streaming, Cache, Memory
LLM integration, caching, metrics, streaming updates

key_features.feature: Complete control over agent behavior via custom system prompts (NEW in v0.3.9+)
Advanced sequential and parallel tool execution with dependency management
Custom personality/behavior injection via directives field
Smart workflow optimization and error recovery

environment_variables.var: OpenAI API key for GPT models
Anthropic API key for Claude models
Serper API key for web search functionality

tools_api.overview: Tools are atomic functions that perform specific tasks. Symphony includes standard tools and supports custom tool creation with advanced features like chaining, caching, and validation.

tool_chaining.overview: Tool chaining allows complex workflows through sequential and parallel execution. Uses the 'chained' field with decimal notation for ordering: "1", "2.1", "2.2", "3"

chaining_rules.rule: Use "1" for first step, "3" for final step
Use decimal notation "2.1", "2.2", "2.3" for parallel intermediates

agents_api.overview: Agents are intelligent entities that can use tools, make decisions, and execute complex tasks. They support custom directives for personality/behavior modification, system prompt override for complete control, and intelligent tool selection.

system_prompt_override.overview: NEW in v0.3.9+: Complete control over agent behavior through custom system prompts. When systemPrompt is provided, it completely overrides default prompt generation. Supports both direct string content and file-based prompts. When systemPrompt is set, the directives field is automatically ignored.

system_prompt_features.feature: Replaces entire default system prompt generation
Load from .xml, .txt, .md files (relative or absolute paths)
Automatically ignores directives when systemPrompt is set
Can reference available tools via prompt content
Enforce specific response formats (JSON, XML, structured text)
Complete control over agent personality and reasoning patterns

teams_api.overview: Teams coordinate multiple agents for complex collaborative tasks with intelligent delegation, load balancing, and strategy-based execution patterns.

pipelines_api.overview: Pipelines orchestrate complex workflows with intelligent optimization, error recovery, and performance monitoring. They support conditional logic, parallel execution, and adaptive routing.

streaming_api.overview: Streaming provides real-time updates during long-running operations with progress tracking, status updates, and live metrics delivery.

issue.name: SystemPrompt not working
issue.symptom: Agent ignores custom systemPrompt, uses default behavior
issue.solution: Ensure you're using Symphony SDK v0.4.1+. Check file paths for file-based prompts. Verify systemPrompt is correctly set in AgentConfig.

issue.name: Tools not found
issue.solution: Ensure tools are registered and spelled correctly in agent config

issue.name: Chain execution fails
issue.solution: Check dependency order, input mappings, and tool availability

issue.name: Agent gives generic responses
issue.symptom: Agent doesn't use tools or follow directives
issue.solution: Check LLM configuration, directives format, and tool descriptions. Consider using systemPrompt for stronger control.

issue.name: SystemPrompt file not loading
issue.symptom: Warns "Failed to load XML template" or file not found errors
issue.solution: Check file path is correct. Use relative paths from project root. Ensure file has proper permissions.

issue.name: Performance issues
issue.solution: Enable parallel execution, optimize tool chains, check resource limits

issue.name: Team coordination problems
issue.solution: Review delegation strategy, agent capabilities, and execution strategy
